primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The diagnosis of the human condition under the Power of Sin and the revelation of God's righteous Wrath as a necessary precursor to Grace.

subject.identificatie: God (as the one who reveals Wrath and initiates the Gospel framework).
tekstueel_bewijs: The wrath of God is revealed from heaven
He begins his letter with the grace and peace of God
God paid [the price] to overcome that resistance

object.identificatie: The truth of the human condition (Conviction of Sin) as a prerequisite for Salvation.
tekstueel_bewijs: an experience of the worst of the problem (is) the opportunity to know the best of the solution
it is one of the great works of the Holy Spirit to convict us of sin

ontvanger.identificatie: All humanity (Jews and Gentiles / The Congregation)
tekstueel_bewijs: There is no distinction... All have sinned
summon every one of us here to realize and to confess
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is positioned as the Receiver of a verdict, not the Subject of a task.

helper.identificatie: The Apostle Paul / The Holy Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: Paul constructs his letter to illustrate...
conviction itself is a working of the grace of God
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject who judges and the Helper (Spirit) who convicts.
helper.rol_van_geest: Indwelling power that enables the 'Savoir-faire' of one's own sinfulness.

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin (as a Power/Condition) and Human Resistance/Evasion.
tekstueel_bewijs: Sin is a condition... a disease, an infection
an actual Power, an alien and hostile force
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Sin is described not as a mistake but as an ontological 'Power' and 'body of death' that humans cannot escape.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The human response of confession and future 'godly living' following the conviction.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/Penitent
secundair_narratief_programma.object: A godly, righteous, and sober life
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics/confession) is explicitly dependent on the primary program (God's conviction/grace).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Holy Spirit → Conviction of Sin → The Hearer
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Paul/Spirit → God (as Judge) ← The Power of Sin

voorbeelden_god_subject: The wrath of God is revealed
He begins his letter with grace

voorbeelden: I can will what is right, but I cannot do it
Let us not evade... the truth about ourselves
to know the enormity of human resistance
we are unable to liberate ourselves
there is no health in us

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Non-Pouvoir-Faire' (Inability) of the human subject, which is the hallmark of a grace-oriented sermon that prepares for a Divine Subject.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: The sermon moves from ~S1 (Cheap Grace) to S2 (Wrath/Death) to prevent the hearer from staying in ~S2 (Evasion). It insists that S1 is only accessible through the acknowledgment of S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is held open; the sermon ends at the 'sinking lifeboat' stage, pointing to Christ as the only hope for resolution.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Extremely high; S2 is presented as a cosmic reality, not a psychological feeling.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: Despite the heavy focus on Sin and Wrath, the sermon is deeply theocentric. It defines Sin as a Power humans cannot overcome, thereby making God the only possible Subject of salvation.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Potential Exemplarism in the closing prayer
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: that we may hereafter live a godly, righteous and sober life

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of the Gospel
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Paul constructs his letter to illustrate that the righteous anger of God is entirely enclosed in his love and mercy.
We are talking about an actual Power, an alien and hostile force.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures (Paul, Adam) are used as actants in a cosmic drama, not as moral examples to follow.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already treats Adam as the source of a condition and Paul as a fellow 'wretched man'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief through the 'good news of original sin'—the burden of self-salvation is removed.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic framework: Salvation must come from outside the human system.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The narrative logic is perfectly consistent: if Sin is a cosmic power (Opponent) and humans are captive (Non-Pouvoir), then only a Divine Subject can act.
spanning_punten: The tension between human responsibility and human inability.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: We are in bondage to the Power of Sin... Who will deliver me?

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit grants the 'Savoir' (knowledge) of sin as a gift of grace.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully avoids moralism by making Sin a 'Heavy Opponent' and God the primary 'Subject' of the Gospel framework.

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Maintain the 'fellow-sufferer' identification established by the preacher.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: This is appropriate for a sermon on Romans 1-3.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Continue to the next sermon in the series to introduce the 'Pouvoir' of the Resurrection.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's Wrath/Grace) correctly precedes and grounds Ethics (Confession).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that uses the 'bad news' to establish the necessity of the 'good news' without falling into moralistic exhortation.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric might focus on the 'shock' of the 'you' turn, Greimas shows this is a shift in actantial positioning from Observer to Receiver.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the text; Greimas explains how the sermon's 'engine' moves the hearer from self-sufficiency to dependency.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the sermon's power comes from the 'Subject-switch'—moving the hearer out of the Subject position entirely.

volledige_subject_lijst: We (have erred, have followed, have offended)
appendices.notities: The sermon is part 1 of a series, which explains the lack of a 'resolution' actant (Christ's specific work) in this specific text, though it is structurally implied.
